---

## Question category 1

<Message type="important">
  Make sure to check out our [list of standard category names](/templates/faq/#faq-categories) to help us keep the documentation organized.
</Message>


### What should my first question be?

You can add any questions (and answers) you think might help the users better use and understand the product. Add links to useful docs to complement the information.

### How long should an answer be?

If the answer is longer than a couple paragraphs, that might warrant the creation of a [dedicated Additional Content page](/templates/additional-content), that you can link to in the FAQ.

## FAQ categories

Below are the existing FAQ categories. Group your queries into those according to the subject they refer to.

### Overview
Introductory content, such as product descriptions, benefits, and use cases.

### Getting started
Frequently asked questions about creating and setting up a product or resource.

### Access and security
Queries related to connecting to an account, such as authentication methods, permissions,  hacking, and phishing.

### Pricing and billing
Questions about cost estimation, savings plan, payment methods, budget, and vouchers or discounts.

### Specifications
Technical requirements, system requirements.

### Quotas and limitations
Anything related to quotas and limits on using our services and integrated third-party tools.

### Offering and availability
Regional availability, product lifecycle, and deprecation policies.

### Compatibility and integration
Info about Scaleway or third-party tools that can be used with the product. Also, APIs, SDKs, and other developer tools.

### Usage and management
Migration, upgrading, downgrading, and transitioning between different products or plans.

### Privacy and safety
GDPR, data protection, cookies, and anything privacy-related.

### Performance
Optimization and known performance issues or limitations.

### Network
Networking protocols, firewall configuration, and network security.

### Support and troubleshooting
Referring users to the Support team or troubleshooting pages. When used, it should be the last category to appear on the FAQ page.
